poem:
**Coins and Commerce**

In the shuffle of minted dreams,  
the jingle of allegiance  
rings hollow. A table set  
with promises—no one buys  
but watches the candor  
crumble,  
as interests intertwine  
like fingers at a market stall,  
where voices barter—  
things unseen,  
things unseen.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From crypto bro to commerce secretary pick: Howard Lutnick’s glaring conflict of interest “What deeply interests me is the interests of America.” Howard Lutnick, chairman and CEO of the Wall Street investment bank Cantor Fitzgerald and Donald Trump’s nominee to become the next secretary of commerce, was speaking to an audience of cryptocurrency enthusiasts last April. “I can’t be bought off. OK? There’s just no possibility someone can come up and say: ‘Hey, I’ll give". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
